node.title: Baltimore Ravens' Malik Harrison Wounded in Cleveland Shooting Halloween Night
node.alt: Malik Harrison of the Baltimore Ravens was wounded in a shooting on Halloween, Pictured, Harrison walks to the field on January 16, 2021 in Orchard Park, New York.
node.description: The team announced the linebacker suffered a "non-life-threatening injury" while visiting his home state over the weekend.
node.content:
["Baltimore Ravens' linebacker Malik Harrison was wounded over the weekend in a shooting while visiting his home state.", "\"On Sunday night while attending a gathering in Cleveland, Malik Harrison sustained a non-life-threatening injury after being struck by a stray bullet in the left calf,\" the team announced on Monday. \"Malik, who received medical care at a local hospital, has been in touch with our team doctors and will return to Baltimore today.\"", "Harrison retweeted the statement from his personal account.", "", "
Malik Harrison of the Baltimore Ravens was wounded in a shooting on Halloween, Pictured, Harrison walks to the field on January 16, 2021 in Orchard Park, New York.
", "The 23-year-old Columbus, Ohio native has played in all seven Ravens games this season, including five starts.", "It is unclear how long Harrison may be off the field at this time.", "The Ravens were on a bye week last week. Coach John Harbaugh is scheduled to meet with the press on Monday afternoon.", "This is a developing story and will be updated as more information becomes available."]
